p: RdRps are considered among primary targets for antiviral drug development, against a wide variety of viruses. Some RdRp inhibitors have been considered to target SARS-CoV-2: Favipiravir [ 17], Galidesivir [ 18], Remdesivir [ 19] and Ribavirin [ 20]. Interestingly, the docking site is not located in proximity to the catalytic domain of the RdRp [ 21]. In addition, other possible drugs such as Filibuvir, Cepharanthine, Simeprevir and Tegobuvir, are predicted to be potential inhibitors of RdRp [ 22]. Naturally occurring mutations in critical residues for drug efficacy can lead to drug resistance phenomena, with a significant loss in the binding affinity of these molecules to the RdRp.
